attributes.action: Bicycles to have insurance, licence, identification plate and pay road tax.
attributes.additional_details: Bicycles can cause serious and expensive damage to cars if there is a collision. If a bicycle is involved in an accident they can ride off or give false contact details and there is no way of finding them again. Cyclists should also take a test to show that they are competent on the road and should be able to receive fines and points like any other road user and cyclists should also pay a Vehicle Excise Duty like all other road users.
attributes.background: As bicycles now have greater rights on public roads and in some cases have priority over cars, the petition asks that bicycles have similar conditions as cars and motorbikes, i.e. take a road competency test, have insurance and have an identification plate.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/604266
